seriesJson.title: They fought alone
seriesJson.description: Drama series on pioneering individuals produced at University of Michigan

node.title: Joseph Lancaster
node.description: In 19th century England, Joseph Lancaster champions the rights of the poor to an education.

node.title: German rocket scientists go west
node.description: German rocket scientists "go with the West" to find the freedom to pursue knowledge for its own sake.

node.title: Galileo
node.description: Galileo fights for the freedom to announce new scientific theories.

node.title: Michael Servetus
node.description: Michael Servetus challenges the medical dogma of the church and is burned at the stake.

node.title: Norwegian teachers resist Nazis
node.description: Norwegian teachers rebel against the Nazi Laerersamband.

node.title: Captain Richard Pratt
node.description: Captain Richard Pratt champions the rights of Native Americans to an education.

node.title: Franklin Jameson
node.description: Franklin Jameson declares teachers must have the rights of all free citizens and be permitted to hold beliefs that run contrary to ones prevalent in their communities.
